embeds.title: Crownarang
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 8 (10) damage.
Berserker **Combo:** Draw 2 (3) Attacks.

messages.content: it is one of the common attacks champ has
much prefer precise thrust and fan of knives due to multihit

Its not bad to have some draw but as far as my experience with the Champ goes, he just does not need it as much, playing mostly few cards per turn, so the actual value from draw is limited

I'd prefer fan of knives tbh yeah
also this isn't true draw
I've taken crownarang for the attack draw once beccause it was spire with friends and  i had the shivs penalty
it was a great way to get the shivs out of my draw pile 👍
Ngl this card would work alot better as a skill
Yeah probably

As frontloaded damage, it's not amazing compared to a lot of champs other options, especially the ones that multihit to synergize with vigor. However, champ has a very hard time drawing cards, especially after the recent patch, and this is one of the easier tools you can find to fix that problem. It certainly transitions into the late game better than a card like fan of knives or encircle. You do need to have good access to berserker stance to consistently use it, but you should usually be prioritizing stance entries on champ anyways for finishers and stance combo cards. You won't be interested in this if you are more focused on defensive combos.

In the fights where you really need to find what little scaling champ has (act 3 and 4), 1-2 upgraded copies of crownarang can be very serviceable to dig you to those pieces faster. The upgrade is really solid, drawing one extra card is pretty nice, and the damage goes up a respectable amount. Can pair well with the ninja relics, as it's a cheap attack that can draw you into more attacks. Also can pair nicely with cheap skills to proc your stance bonuses faster, as you can draw into and play several 0 cost skills. I think this card fits as a solid roleplayer for champ, not an all star you are taking every time, but very serviceable when you have some support for it.
I do have to object to "transitions into lategame better than fan of knives"
at worst, fan of knives is a double hit
It can't draw skills, it only draws attacks

Huh, thats a RTFC moment for me. I misread it as drawing cards, not specifically attacks. In that case, ignore everything about the skills, and the ability to find your scaling cards. This card is much worse than I thought it was.
Yeah if it was just any draw it would be a top champ card, just like old <circumvent> was before it was decided that it no longer should exist.

embeds.title: Circumvent
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Gain 7 (10) **Block** :p_block:.
Draw 2 cards.
Discard 2 cards.

messages.content: this card is alright, the activation condition is trivial and being able to draw 2 attacks can be quite good if you can afford them. You wont always be able to play this but its solid when you can; its fairly comparable to a common version of Violence.
this card is has good synergy with <devastate> and gut punch

embeds.title: Devastate
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 5 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 6 (9) damage 3 times.
Costs 1 less :energy_champ: for each Finisher played this combat.

messages.content: In what way?? I don't really see it having good synergy with either of them.
i imagine drawing devastate early means you don't have a dead draw on a later turn
and drawing gut punch fast means entering ultimate stance fast
which means you win fast
because ultimate stance is still broken
Yes but you just spent 2 energy to play gut punch so you don't have the energy to abuse it
That isn't "synergizing" that's just devastate being a bad card.
unless you spend your 3rd energy on <refreshments>, then you can continue your aforementioned "win fast" strats

messages.content: comparable stats
<gut punch>

embeds.title: Gut Punch
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 8 (12) damage.
Any **Stance** **Combo:** Enter **Ultimate** **Stance** for 1 turn.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: these sound like they should be directed at ahoodedman, i was just stating possibilities
i don't play champ
devastate has no synergy with anything even finishers
it's just garbage lol
unless your deck is packed with moment of truths or something you're not likely to even get to play devastate for any reasonable cost before you just win most hallway/elite fights
and it's most likely dead first cycle
snecko eye?
i guess
then devastate becomes really good
but also
snecko eye incentivizes taking more draw and guess what champ doesn't really have
so it'll be
even more inconsistent than normal champ
snecko eye gives draw
and guess what champ doesn't really have
i guess if you grab a last stand or orange pellets it could be quite strong
not really a reliable pick like on snecko or guardian though
snecko eye doesn't incentivize taking more draw
snecko eye IS your draw
yes its to do that. It also gets you the card when it costs 0 or 1 later in the fight.

as for gut punch, its just good to have an out to draw it when your hand is full of cards you want to use with ultimate stnace. It can also let fill your hands with attack finishers to use alongside gut punch.
So for the first cycle it's still a complete dead card, and it just lets you draw it slightly faster when it is 0 cost?

The majority of fights are done by the time it is 0 cost, and it's still a dead draw. The only time I could see the card forced into your deck is from the cards gremlin, which the chances of this happening are very low. So you can just simply skip the card and not have to deal with it.

You're still using 2 energy to activate ultimate stance, which severely hampers your ability to abuse ultimate. I'd consider a situation where you have 3 energy and use crownarang to draw gut punch a pretty bad draw tbh. Just means you won't draw gut punch naturally this cycle (and have the energy to use it to its fullest effect) and you ideally want to use your ultimate cards in the first few turns of combat, because by the end of your second cycle the majority of things are dead.

The only situation I could see it being fine in is if you have refreshments, which is unlikely that you draw crownarang abd refreshments in the same hand, then use crown to draw gut punch, but it is possible I guess.
Or if you have a lot of moment of truth spam, but in that situation I still don't think using crownarang to draw the gut punch would make it better than just naturally drawing gut punch.
Crownarang also anti-synergizes with itself, since it drawing attacks means you'd ideally use it to draw a multihit to use your vigor effectively, but it uses your vigor
your pretty much not ever taking crownarang on 3 energy, you need more to acutally make use of it. like how you woudlnt take a act 1 violence.
oh I would take an act 1 violence
if I didn't have to pay for it
reminder that violence is 0 cost
well you do have to pay for violence if its in act one
insert option for rare colourless card
thats still paying for it though, your skipping the other blessings or rare cards

that is the real problem with the card, its why you don't take it every run. Champ is often stacking Vigor so having a set up attack like this wont work out when you want to just blow up the enemy in one hit.
Crownarang is still decent when your not trying to stack up a lot of vigor every fight; or as supplemental draw for a character that really needs to draw cards.
